p: We identified a single case report from Malaysia, of an acute episode of psychosis seemingly precipitated by fear and distress associated with COVID-19 ( Zulkifli et al., 2020). The 31-year-old male patient had no previous history of mental disorder and did not use illicit substances. He responded well to a low dose antipsychotic. However, causality cannot be implied, as there are usually several aetiological factors that lead to the development of a psychotic disorder and the anxiety that precipitated the episode may have just been the most proximal factor.
